content:
Hello, My name is Sahibpreet Kaur, I am from Punjab, India. I am a web-design trainee at Ryaz (https://ryaz.io/). I have a little experience in technical writing and I am more than eager to take part in GSoD. I am looking up for the project ideas. I was just wondering where to get started. Any type of suggestions are welcome. Thank you.
c.c.: @Sean
Welcome @Sahibpreet Kaur Can you elaborate more on your technical writing experience? Any samples of things you've worked on that you can share?

As for getting started, your best bet would probably be to download and install BRL-CAD, and go through some of the "Introduction to MGED" tutorials. That's how most get started so it'll give you relevant perspective on introductory documentation.

Welcome Sahibpreet Kaur Can you elaborate more on your technical writing experience? Any samples of things you've worked on that you can share?

@Sean Here is the link to my blog posts (https://sahibkaurblog.wordpress.com/). I write about topics and problems I across during my training.

Thanks @Sahibpreet Kaur ! That's a very nice blog you have there. I appreciate the casual self-discovery tone you use and the overall simplicity. It shows you have a brave character that is willing to learn, not fear challenges, and that is wonderful. I do hope you apply.

Hello, I am Kamal from India. I am a competent article writer and can elaborate my skills on writing both formal and informal writings on any given topic. Also I am training in Web Development. I am really excited to participate in Google Season of Docs. Any suggestions about how to get started would be really helpful! :slight_smile:
Welcome @Kamal Kaur Your introduction sounds promising. Can you provide us with links to examples of your work?
@Kamal Kaur thank you for the files, but will it be possible for you to put these articles online somewhere, may be medium.com / wordpress/ brl-cad wiki ?

Sure @pooh (inder) :slight_smile:
Here's the link to my published articles ( https://medium.com/@kamalshcs )
